meanings.definition: A person who is excessively self-centered and believes in their own importance.
meanings.sent1: The egoist only cared about themselves and never considered others.
meanings.sent2: She was known as an egoist because she always put her needs above everyone else's.
meanings.sent3: The egoist thought the world revolved around them, quite literally!
meanings.sent4: His egoist nature created a bubble around him, isolating him from genuine connections.
meanings.sent5: The egoist's self-importance was as vast as the ocean, drowning out any other voices.

meanings.definition: Someone who is selfish and only thinks of their own interests.
meanings.sent1: Being an egoist, he never shared his toys with others.
meanings.sent2: The egoist refused to help anyone unless it benefited them directly.
meanings.sent3: The egoist's selfishness knew no bounds, even when it came to sharing snacks.
meanings.sent4: Her egoist tendencies made her a lone wolf in a world of teamwork.
meanings.sent5: The egoist's self-centeredness cast a shadow on any chance of collaboration.

meanings.definition: The belief that self-interest is the motivating force of all conscious action.
meanings.sent1: The egoist's philosophy centered around the idea that self-interest drives all decisions.
meanings.sent2: In his egoist mindset, he believed that everyone acted out of personal gain.
meanings.sent3: The egoist's theory that self-interest rules all seemed both intriguing and flawed.
meanings.sent4: Her egoist belief painted a picture of a world driven by individual desires.
meanings.sent5: The egoist's conviction in self-interest as the core of human behavior was unwavering.
